intro: Aerva microphylla, commonly known as small-leaved aerva, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of tiny, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant is often found growing in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Aerva microphylla is also used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
